intro: Astragalus maaratensis, commonly known as the Maarat Mountain milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its root system is known for its medicinal properties, often used in traditional herbal remedies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
